original_title: Sri Lanka’s Commercial Bank debenture issue oversubscribed
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Commercial Bank of Ceylon Plc issued 60 million, Basel III compliant – tier 2 listed rated unsecured subordinated redeemable debentures with a non-viability conversion feature, at LKR100 each.

The goal was to raise 6 billion rupees with an option to issue up to a further 60 million of said debentures to raise up to a further 6 billion rupees at the discretion of the bank, in the event of an oversubscription of the initial issue, the bank said in a statement.

“We wish to inform you that we have received applications for over 120,000,000 debentures (Rs 12,000,000,000) for the above debenture issue by Commercial Bank of Ceylon PLC, and accordingly the issue has been oversubscribed.”
The basis of allotment will be notified to the CSE in due course. (Colombo/Dec13/2023)
